alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 2:01PM EDT until May 19 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Dubois County in south central Indiana... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 201 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lynnville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Dubois County, including the following locations... Celestine, Saint Marks, Millersport, Bretzville, Huntingburg, Mentor, Duff, Ferdinand, Huntingburg Airport and Saint Anthony. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
